content: Hey Guys anyone knows good Crypto Crowdfunding Sites or normal Crowdfunding Sites?

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.body: Quote from: Dop93 on June 23, 2022, 04:23:40 PMHey Guys anyone knows good Crypto Crowdfunding Sites or normal Crowdfunding Sites? The nature of crypto makes it difficult to raise funds.  In the past, many people have taking investments for everything you can think of.  Unfortunately, 99.9% of the time they turn out to be scams that run away with the money.  It happened so frequently that the smart contract industry was born on Ethereum to counter this phenomenon.  In fact, to my knowledge there is only one organization still operating from back in the pre-ICO Bitcoin investment days on the GLBSE.  As rare as a needle in a haystack, and unlikely to ever be duplicated at the community level. https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=86854.0

comments.author: OmegaStarScream
comments.created_time: June 23, 2022, 05:50:53 PMLast edit: June 23, 2022, 06:32:15 PM by OmegaStarScream
comments.body: I'm not aware of any crypto platforms, not any good ones anyway. I think the best way would be to just create a site for your service/product and then add BTCPayServer to raise the funds. And for exposure, you can simply advertise the site online. But as mentioned above, it's not going to be that easy and unless you have a working product/service or a prototype, you probably won't find much support.

comments.author: The Cryptovator
comments.body: Are you wondering to raise funds for your project? The traditional crowdfunding system is almost dead. Nowadays it's hard to find crowdfunding sites. It depends on the nature of the projects. Crypto Projects have been using Launchpad to raise funds Nowadays that is called IDO. You may use Google to find a good Launchpad to raise funds for your project, and of course, you need a token for that. Raising funds in your own website is quite impossible lately.

comments.author: Potato Chips
comments.body: or use the usual go-to fiat crowdfunding platforms and then redirect the people who wants to pay crypto off-site if that's allowed otherwise you can do it subtly by inputing your handles (e.g. website, social medias, etc...) in your post. I imagine most people interested on chipping in would at least visit your website.
